title: Cuyahoga Valley National Park: Professional Development
body: Professional Development        Teacher Workshops Great Lakes Earth Partnership for Schools Teacher Workshop Monday through Friday, June 23 - 27 and Saturday, September 27— Use the outdoors as an educational tool to learn about native ecosystems and how you can transform your schoolyard into a learning lab. Fee: $150 include graduate credit. For more information or to register, contact Connie Dagas at 330-657-2796 ext. 100 or cdages@forcvnp.org. All Teacher Workshops     Teacher-Ranger-Teachers Hey teachers - want to spend a summer living and working in a national park? This is the program for you - work as a park ranger for the summer, then bring the stories and lessons of Cuyahoga Valley back to your students.  All Teacher-Ranger-Teachers     Historical & Environmental Education Reading CVNP partnered with Western Reserve Public Media to create a free teacher's guide, Generations: Cuyahoga Valley National Park—Preserve and Protect, with middle school lesson plans in mathematics, science, social studies, art, and language arts. This guide is a companion piece to the one-hour Generations: Cuyahoga Valley National Park documentary and the national PBS series, America’s Best Idea.
